class.description: Represents a JSON object, which contains an unordered set of name/value pairs. Each value can be a string, number, JSON object, JSON array, true, false, or null.

method.name: AddArrayAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new and empty JSON array member to the position indicated by ARG1. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AddBoolAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new boolean member to the position indicated by ARG1. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AddIntAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new integer member to the position indicated by ARG1. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AddNullAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new null member to the position indicated by ARG1. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AddNumberAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new numeric member to the position indicated by ARG1. The ARG3 is an integer, float, or double already converted to a string in the format desired by the application. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AddObjectAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new and empty JSON object member to the position indicated by ARG1. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AddStringAt
method.descrip: Inserts a new string member to the position indicated by ARG1. To prepend, pass an ARG1 of 0. To append, pass an ARG1 of -1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: AppendArray
method.descrip: Appends a new and empty JSON array and returns it.

method.name: AppendBool
method.descrip: Appends a new boolean member. (This is the same as passing -1 to the AddBoolAt method.)

method.name: AppendInt
method.descrip: Appends a new integer member. (This is the same as passing an index of -1 to the AddIntAt method.)

method.name: AppendObject
method.descrip: Appends a new and empty JSON object and returns it.

method.name: AppendString
method.descrip: Appends a new string member. (This is the same as passing -1 to the AddStringAt method.)

method.name: ArrayAt
method.descrip: Returns the JSON array that is the value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: ArrayOf
method.descrip: Returns the JSON array at the specified ARG1.

method.name: BoolAt
method.descrip: Returns the boolean value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: BoolOf
method.descrip: Returns the boolean at the specified ARG1.

method.name: Delete
method.descrip: Deletes the member at having the name specified by ARG1.

method.name: DeleteAt
method.descrip: Deletes the member at index ARG1. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: Emit
method.descrip: Writes the JSON document (rooted at the caller) and returns as a string.

method.name: FirebaseApplyEvent
method.descrip:
Applies a Firebase event to the JSON. The ARG2 contains JSON having a format such as 
{"path": "/", "data": {"a": 1, "b": 2}}
The ARG1 should be "put" or "patch".

method.name: FirebasePatch
method.descrip: For each key in the ARG2, update (or add) the corresponding key in the JSON at the given ARG1. The ARG1 is relative to this JSON object. (This is effectively applying a Firebase patch event.)

method.name: FirebasePut
method.descrip:
Inserts or replaces the value at the ARG1. The ARG2 can contain JSON text, an integer (in decimal string format), a boolean (true/false), the keyword "null", or a quoted string.

The ARG1 is relative to this JSON object. (This is effectively applying a Firebase put event.)

method.name: GetDocRoot
method.descrip: Returns the root of the JSON document. The root can be obtained from any JSON object within the JSON document. The entire JSON document remains in memory as long as at least one JSON object is referenced by the application. When the last reference is removed, the entire JSON document is automatically dellocated.

link.text: Get the Root of a JSON Document

method.name: HasMember
method.descrip: Returns _TRUE_ if the item at the ARG1 exists.

method.name: IndexOf
method.descrip: Returns the index of the member having the given ARG1. Returns -1 if the name is not found.

link.text: Get the Index of a JSON Member

method.name: IntAt
method.descrip: Returns the integer value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: IntOf
method.descrip: Returns the integer at the specified ARG1.

method.name: IsNullAt
method.descrip: Returns the boolean value of the member having the specified ARG1.

method.name: IsNullOf
method.descrip: Returns _TRUE_ if the value at the specified ARG1 is null. Otherwise returns _FALSE_.

method.name: Load
method.descrip: Parses a JSON string and loads it into this JSON object to provide DOM-style access.

link.text: Loading and Parsing a JSON Array

method.name: LoadFile
method.descrip: Loads a JSON file into this JSON object. The ARG1 is the file path to the JSON file.

method.name: NameAt
method.descrip: Returns the name of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: ObjectAt
method.descrip: Returns the JSON object that is the value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: ObjectOf
method.descrip: Returns the JSON object at the specified ARG1.

method.name: Rename
method.descrip: Renames the member named ARG1 to ARG2.

method.name: RenameAt
method.descrip: Renames the member at ARG1 to ARG2.

method.name: SetBoolAt
method.descrip: Sets the boolean value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: SetBoolOf
method.descrip: Sets the boolean value at the specified ARG1.

method.name: SetIntAt
method.descrip: Sets the integer value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: SetIntOf
method.descrip: Sets the integer at the specified ARG1.

method.name: SetNullAt
method.descrip: Sets the value of the Nth member to null. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: SetNullOf
method.descrip: Sets the value at the specified ARG1 to null.

method.name: SetNumberAt
method.descrip: Sets the numeric value of the Nth member. The ARG2 is an integer, float, or double already converted to a string in the format desired by the application. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: SetNumberOf
method.descrip: Sets the numeric value at the specified ARG1. The ARG2 is an integer, float, or double already converted to a string in the format desired by the application.

method.name: SetStringAt
method.descrip: Sets the string value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: SetStringOf
method.descrip: Sets the string value at the specified ARG1.

method.name: SizeOfArray
method.descrip: Returns the size of the array at the given ARG1. Returns -1 if the ARG1 does not evaluate to an existent JSON array.

method.name: StringAt
method.descrip: Returns the string value of the Nth member. Indexing is 0-based (the 1st member is at index 0).

method.name: StringOf
method.descrip: Returns the string value at the specified ARG1.

link.text: JSON Paths that need Double Quotes

method.name: TypeAt
method.descrip:
Returns the type of data at the given ARG1. Possible return values are:
  1. string
  2. number
  3. object
  4. array
  5. boolean
  6. null
Returns -1 if no member exists at the given ARG1.

method.name: LoadSb
method.descrip: Loads JSON from the contents of a StringBuilder object.

method.name: EmitSb
method.descrip: Appends the JSON to a StringBuilder object.

method.name: UpdateString
method.descrip:
Updates or appends a new string member. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed.

Important: Prior to version 9.5.0.68, the string passed in to this method did not get properly JSON escaped. This could cause problems if non-us-ascii chars are present, or if certain special chars such as quotes, CR's, or LF's are present. Version 9.5.0.68 fixes the problem.

method.name: UpdateInt
method.descrip: Updates or appends a new integer member. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed.

method.name: UpdateBool
method.descrip: Updates or appends a new boolean member. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed.

method.name: FindRecord
method.descrip: Finds a JSON record in an array where a particular field equals or matches a value pattern. Reviewing the example below is the best way to understand this function.

method.name: FindRecordString
method.descrip: Finds a JSON value in an record array where a particular field equals or matches a value pattern. Reviewing the example below is the best way to understand this function.

method.name: UpdateNumber
method.descrip: Updates or appends a new numeric member. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed.

method.name: UpdateNull
method.descrip: Updates or appends a null member. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed.

method.name: Clone
method.descrip: Returns a copy of this JSON object.

method.name: EmitWithSubs
method.descrip: Emits the JSON document with variable substitutions applied. If ARG2 is _TRUE_, then members having empty strings or empty arrays are omitted.

method.name: Predefine
method.descrip: Adds or replaces this JSON to an internal global set of predefined JSON documents that can be subsequently loaded by ARG1.

method.name: LoadPredefined
method.descrip: Loads this JSON object from a predefined document having a specified ARG1.

method.name: AppendStringArray
method.descrip: Appends an array of string values.

method.name: FindObjectWithMember
method.descrip: Recursively searches the JSON subtree rooted at the caller's node for a JSON object containing a member having a specified ARG1. (If the caller is the root node of the entire JSON document, then the entire JSON document is searched.) Returns the first match or _NULL_ if not found.

method.name: JsonTypeOf
method.descrip:
Returns the type of data at the given ARG1. Possible return values are:
  1. string
  2. number
  3. object
  4. array
  5. boolean
  6. null
Returns -1 if no member exists at the given ARG1.

method.name: StringOfSb
method.descrip: Appends the string value at the specified ARG1 to ARG2.

method.name: BytesOf
method.descrip: Appends the binary bytes at the specified ARG1 to ARG3. The ARG2 indicates the encoding of the bytes, such as "base64", "hex", etc.

method.name: UpdateSb
method.descrip: Updates or appends a new string member with the contents of ARG2. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed.

method.name: UpdateBd
method.descrip: Updates or appends a new string member with the encoded contents of ARG3. If the full path specified by ARG1 does not exist, it is automatically created as needed. The bytes contained in ARG3 are encoded according to ARG2 (such as "base64", "hex", etc.)

property.name: DelimiterChar
property.descrip: Sets the delimiter char for JSON paths. The default value is ".". To use Firebase style paths, set this property to "/". (This is a string property that should have a length of 1 char.)

property.name: EmitCompact
property.descrip:
If _TRUE_ then the Emit method outputs in the most compact form possible (a single-line with no extra whitespace). If _FALSE_, then emits with whitespace and indentation to make the JSON human-readable.

The default value is _TRUE_.

property.name: EmitCrLf
property.descrip:
If _TRUE_ then the Emit method uses CRLF line-endings when emitting the non-compact (pretty-print) format. If _FALSE_, then bare-LF's are emitted. (The compact format emits to a single line with no end-of-line characters.) Windows systems traditionally use CRLF line-endings, whereas Linux, Mac OS X, and other systems traditionally use bare-LF line-endings.

The default value is _TRUE_.

property.name: I
property.descrip: The value of the "i" index to be used when evaluating a JSON path.

property.name: J
property.descrip: The value of the "j" index to be used when evaluating a JSON path.

property.name: K
property.descrip: The value of the "k" index to be used when evaluating a JSON path.

property.name: Size
property.descrip: The number of name/value members in this JSON object.
